Package controller

Class appointmentsController

java.lang.Object
controller.appointmentsController
public class appointmentsController extends Object
FXML Controller class for the Appointments page of the Holladay Pediatric Scheduler.

  • Constructor Details

    • appointmentsController

      public appointmentsController()

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize() throws Exception
      Initializes the controller class. On launch, all the Appointment page attributes are set up. All buttons make use of lambda expression functionality, as well as the Observable Lists.
      Throws:
      Exception - = thrown in the event of an unforeseen error.

      LAMBDA - setOnAction: These lambda expressions work in conjunction with the void executable methods. When any of the page buttons or radio buttons are interacted with, the respective methods are called. When called, the methods run the executable functionality for the features of the Appointments page. All the buttons, normal and radio, have event handlers in the lambda expression statement which acts as an input. This separation results in less code having to be written and is more readable and concise for others who may be working with the Scheduler program.

    • retrieveSearchedAppointment

      public void retrieveSearchedAppointment(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws Exception
      The search field looks up the appointment in the database by either the ID or name. If successful, the Appointments TableView will populate with the given results.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - = instance of ActionEvent object.
      Throws:
      Exception

    • sortAllAppointmentsClicked

      public void sortAllAppointmentsClicked()
      RadioButton that has the TableView show all Appointment entries, works in conjunction with the lambda expression.

      LAMBDA - listEveryAppointment.forEach: Iterates through and sets the Appointment TableView to show all entries by setting items to the respective ObservableList. A for loop would result in slightly more code having to be written. Using a lambda expression here is a neater and more readable implementation.

    • sortAppointmentsWeekClicked

      public void sortAppointmentsWeekClicked()
      RadioButton that has the TableView sort Appointments by week, works in conjunction with the lambda expression.

      LAMBDA - listEveryAppointment.forEach: Iterates through and sets the Appointment TableView to show the entries within the span of a week by setting items to the respective ObservableList. A for loop would result in slightly more code having to be written. Using a lambda expression here is a neater and more readable implementation.

    • sortAppointmentsMonthClicked

      public void sortAppointmentsMonthClicked()
      RadioButton that has the TableView sort Appointments by month, works in conjunction with the lambda expression.

      LAMBDA - listEveryAppointment.forEach: Iterates through and sets the Appointment TableView to show all entries within the span of a month by setting items to the respective ObservableList. A for loop would result in slightly more code having to be written. Using a lambda expression here is a neater and more readable implementation.

    • createNewAppointmentClicked

      public void createNewAppointmentClicked() throws IOException
      Validates the user input and adds a new appointment if successful, works in conjunction with the lambda expression.
      Throws:
      IOException - = thrown in the event of an unforeseen error.

      LAMBDA - retrieveUsers: Iterates through and filters the User IDs to find one that matches between the User object and the respective ObservableList. If successful, it gets added to the list. The forEach expression contained within doesn't use as much code as a for loop would, resulting in a clean and concise expression. retrieveCustomers: Iterates through and filters the Customer IDs to find one that matches between the Customer object and the respective ObservableList. If successful, it gets added to the list. The forEach expression contained within doesn't use as much code as a for loop would, resulting in a clean and concise expression.

    • editAppointmentClicked

      public void editAppointmentClicked()
      Allows the user to make edits to an already existing appointment, works in conjunction with the lambda expression.

      LAMBDA - retrieveAppointmentContacts: Iterates through and retrieves the contact names, as well as matching between the Contacts object and the respective ObservableList. If successful, it gets added to the list. Using a for loop instead would require more a bit more code to be written and wouldn't be as readable and elegant as a lambda expression.

    • removeAppointmentClicked

      public void removeAppointmentClicked()
      Allows the user to remove an appointment from the scheduler records, works in conjunction with the lambda expression.

    • appointmentSaveToRecordsClicked

      public void appointmentSaveToRecordsClicked()
      Allows the user to save edits made to an existing appointment, works in conjunction with the lambda expression.

      LAMBDA - retrieveUsersSave: Iterates through and filters the User IDs to find one that matches between the User object and the respective ObservableList. If successful, it gets added to the list. The forEach expression contained within doesn't use as much code as a for loop would, resulting in a clean and concise expression. retrieveCustomersSave: Iterates through and filters the Customer IDs to find one that matches between the Customer object and the respective ObservableList. If successful, it gets added to the list. The forEach expression contained within doesn't use as much code as a for loop would, resulting in a clean and concise expression.
